description:
The nova.tests.api.openstack.test_images.LocalImageServiceTest test class will create a LocalImageService instance, which creates the directory /tmp/nova/images if it doesn't exist. This directory will only be writeable by the original owner.

if a different user account then tries to run the tests on the same development machine, all calls to LocalImageService.update will fail, which causes all nova.tests.api.openstack.test_images.LocalImageServiceTests to fail, for example:

======================================================================
ERROR: test_create (nova.tests.api.openstack.test_images.LocalImageServiceTest)
----------------------------------------------------------------------
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/var/lib/hudson/hpc-trunk/nova/tests/api/openstack/test_images.py", line 57, in test_create
    id = self.service.create(self.context, fixture)
  File "/var/lib/hudson/hpc-trunk/nova/image/local.py", line 64, in create
    self.update(context, id, data)
  File "/var/lib/hudson/hpc-trunk/nova/image/local.py", line 72, in update
    raise exception.NotFound
NotFound: None
title: LocalImageService tests fail for user 'B' if user 'A' has previously run test on same machine
